page.title: 13Religion
page.content: The religious needs of the community are served by the parish church, a gospel hall and a monthly service in the United Reform Church. The parish priest lives in Thorncombe and shares his time between three other churches in adjoining parishes. He has the support of a number of people on the parochial curch council and leading various church groups. The parish experiences common difficultties in getting younger members of the community to regularly witness to their faith. They maintain their endeavours through youth groups guitar groups and special services for young mothers with toddlers. The small gospel hall seems busy and thriving and in general although the congregation would welcome more people to itself, the village is aware of its church and its value.
